context: The word 'relvi' is the partitive case of Estonian noun 'relv', which means 'weapon'. The partitive case indicates an object that is being possessed, requested, or exists in some quantity but not necessarily complete. In the examples: 'Relvi palun!' (Weapons please!), 'Kus on relvi?' (Where are the weapons?), and 'Mul on relvi.' (I have weapons).
